text.title: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor

head.s: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor

p.s: Driving an outboard motorboat is a ton of fun .
Here are instructions on how to do it .

list.item: Position yourself so you are straddling the seat nearest the motor .

item.s: Prime the motor by squeezing the primer bulb on the fuel line until resistance is felt .
Never squeeze the bulb while the motor is running .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 2.jpg

item.s: Make sure the boat is in neutral .
Generally , this will be with the shift lever in the up position , or the middle position between reverse and forward .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 3.jpg

item.s: Advance the throttle to the " start " position .
This may be indicated , or can be approximated by putting the throttle at 1/3 power .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 4.jpg

item.s: If the engine is cold ( has n't been started recently ) pull out the choke knob .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 5.jpg

item.s: It may help to stand up straddling the seat during this part .
Pull the handle out until it stops , then give it a quick , long yank on the rope .
It probably wo n't start the first time , so try many times .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 6.jpg

item.s: If the engine does not start in 3-4 pulls , push the choke in and try again 3-4 times .
Alternate with the choke in and out .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 7.jpg

item.s: When the engine fires , adjust the choke inwards to provide a smooth idle , and adjust the throttle to a slow speed .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 8.jpg

item.s: Put the motor into either forward or reverse , depending where you are .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 9.jpg

item.s: To steer the boat , pull the handle with your hand to turn .
Twisting it toward you will make the boat go faster , and twisting it away from you will make it go slower .
Pushing the motor away will turn it right , and vice versa .

figure.rend: Drive a Boat With an Outboard Motor Step 10.jpg

item.s: It is a very good idea to have an experienced driver in the boat with you .
Take a boating course and get a license if you are going to be boating .
Different States of Australia have differing requirements for licensing .
In Queensland you need a licence even if boating on private property in a boat with a motor over 6hp .
These courses are very informative

list.item:
All outboard fuel tanks have a breather valve , or on top of the outboard ( if it has an integral fuel tank )
This must be opened ( anti clockwise ) to allow air to replace the spent fuel in the tank , if you do not do this the engine wo n't start or it will stall after a short distance .

item.s: Make sure you have enough fuel for your trip .
A good practice is the " three-thirds " rule , one-third of your fuel for the trip out , one third back and one-third as a reserve .
Ensure your fuel line ( from a tote tank ) in FIRMLY fitted and ' snaps ' in to motor connection .
Untie the stern first from the dock ( motor running and in neutral ) then the bow last . turn away from the dock and reverse out ( this minimizes scraping side of hull against dock ) .
Make sure you are using a good quality oil lubricant .
Shift at low speeds .
Adjust your weight in the boat to maintain a level attitude .
Ensure that the engine has a full crankcase of oil ( 4-stroke engines ) or has the correct gas-oil mixture in the gas tank ( generally 50 parts of gasoline to 1 part oil in modern engines ) .
